title: How to Bypass “Virus Detected” Error on Google Chrome

steps.title: Press ⊞ Win and type "Windows security".
steps.content: Press ⊞ Win and type "Windows security". This will open your Start menu and begin a search for what you're typing.

steps.title: Click the "Windows Security" system settings result.
steps.content: Click the "Windows Security" system settings result. Settings will open a window to the Windows Security suite.

steps.title: Click Virus & threat protection.
steps.content: Click Virus & threat protection . It has the icon of a shield and is usually the first listing in the menu.

steps.title: Click Manage settings under "Virus & threat protection settings.
steps.content: Click Manage settings under "Virus & threat protection settings. " This is usually the second listing in the menu.

steps.title: Click the switch under "Real-time protection" to turn it off .
steps.content: Click the switch under "Real-time protection" to turn it off . You should be able to return to your download and complete it before the feature automatically turns back on. [1] X Research source You'll most likely need to repeat this process if you have multiple downloads failing due to the "Virus Detected" error.
